document.title: The Forgiveness Classroom: Bringing Together Students from Both Sides of the Walls through Deep Listening
document.abstract: This essay describes a forgiveness course taught in prisons and on college campuses. The course served as a bridge for Endicott College students and inmates from the Maine Correctional Center at Windham, highlighting how deep listening may reduce violence and promote understanding.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Ruth Henderson’s research and fieldwork centers on forgiveness in the aftermath of trauma and the role that narrative plays in the forgiveness process. Her work takes her to South Africa, Germany, Israel, and into New England prisons where she has worked as an arts therapist and educator for over twelve years. She created a seminar on forgiveness for incarcerated men through Boston University’s Prison Education Program, and she now teaches this course on college campuses.
